siteMetadata.title: Aaron Van Bokhoven - Software Developer
siteMetadata.subtitle: Software developer working with Ruby, Go, and JavaScript. Hobbyist street photographer and climber.

frontmatter.title: Rails Inspired Logging in Go
frontmatter.description: Verbose logging in development is one of the few things I miss about Ruby on Rails. I made two libraries to bring that to Go and explain how to set that up with middleware.

frontmatter.title: Simple Website Text Scraping with Go and AWS Lambda
frontmatter.description: In this article I’ll be showing you how to compile the Go script, setup the AWS Lambda function, and configure a cron type job to run the script every hour.

frontmatter.title: Chaining API requests with redux-thunk
frontmatter.description: I recently came upon a simple problem where I couldn’t find an easy solution to, on the Google or SO. However, I did find the parts to the answer, and put them together to get this working.

frontmatter.title: A Simple React Native Redux Example
frontmatter.description: Working on my latest React Native project, I decided to make the jump from React’s state to Redux.

frontmatter.title: Automate Tarsnap in OSX with Ruby
frontmatter.description: Automate Tarnsap backups, Tarsnap logging, and Tarsnap backup rotations for OSX, with Ruby.

frontmatter.title: Selection Sort in Ruby
frontmatter.description: Implementing Selection Sort in Ruby

frontmatter.title: Intro to Elasticsearch and Ruby on Rails, Part 1
frontmatter.description: An introduction to Elasticsearch and Ruby on Rails 4: searching, associations, and method values.

frontmatter.description: Implementing Bubble Sort in Ruby

frontmatter.title: A Polymorphic Join Table
frontmatter.description: Not your ordinary polymorphic association, but a polymoprhic join table for Ruby on Rails.

frontmatter.title: Pagination and page cache sweepers in Rails 3
Rails caching and undefined class/module
frontmatter.description: If you are using Rails.cache, and you are using it to store objects using Marshal.dump and Marshal.load, which is default, I'm sure you've experienced this error.

frontmatter.title: Recurring resque and redis with cron
frontmatter.description: Moving one of my projects over from delayed_job to resque/redis, for reasons I wont go into here, I needed to have a few of my workers on a cron job.

frontmatter.title: Ajax checkbox in Ruby on Rails 2.3
frontmatter.description: Neat trick if you want to use Ajax on a checkbox and don't want to create a separate function for onclick.

frontmatter.title: Recurring delayed_job with cron
frontmatter.description: This one is easy and I use it quite often - particularly to scrape data at certain times during the day, and generate nightly statistics and reports.

frontmatter.title: Facebook Connect Javascript Cookie and Ruby on Rails
frontmatter.description: I wrote this class to verify(using Facebook's cookie verification article) and parse the Facebook Javascript Connect cookie.

frontmatter.title: PDFKit and wkhtmltopdf without X Server, using qt
frontmatter.description: If your PDFKit and wkhtmltopdf is working on your development server, probably in OSX, but not working on your production server, which is probably running linux, it's because you're missing X Server.

frontmatter.title: Ruby Hash to Class Object and OpenStruct
Ruby Array to Javascript Array
frontmatter.description: Here's a little gem I found a while ago that I'm reusing in my current project.

frontmatter.title: Validations For Multiple Nested Model Forms
frontmatter.description: Here's a little trick I found when handling multiple nested models in a form that require validations for each model.

frontmatter.title: Adding A Simple Search In 5 Minutes to a Ruby on Rails Site
frontmatter.description: Prototyping a site in Ruby on Rails and need to add a simple search feature in less than 5 minutes?

frontmatter.title: Reoccur Scheduling With Starling and Workling
frontmatter.description: How I moved from BackgrounDRb to Starling and Workling to not only manage my daily worker, but also everything else that needed regular background processing.

frontmatter.title: Paperclip Amazon S3 Background Upload Using Starling and Workling
frontmatter.description: We know it’s very easy to add S3 support into Paperclip, and there’s tons of information on setting that up. It works flawless and it’s simple, yet your upload now takes twice as long in comparison to using your servers filesystem for storage. The problem is pretty obvious and I’ll explain why in this article.
